intro: Eunomia trinervia, commonly known as the three-veined eunomia, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its delicate, palmate leaves with three primary veins. Its small, fragrant flowers are typically pink or white and bloom during the warmer months. Eunomia trinervia is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
